location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 30 to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter describes in detail the movements of Major Gils and reports news of the preliminaries of peace between Great Britain and Spain and France.News - via the Bussora Resident LaTouche - of a recent engagement between the Chaub [the Banu Ka'b tribal confederacy] and some Bussora vessels is discussed. Numerous packets sent and received are also discussed. It is reported that Shaikh Nassir has returned to Bushire and the Fort of Bahreen [Bahrain] was surrendered to Arab forces.The letter states that monthly accounts for March to June and a set of general books May 1782 to April 1783 were enclosed with it (these are not contained in the file).
